channel.title: OFOTCN - Coincidential Reference
channel.description:
I've been reading '[b]One Flew Over The Cuckoo's Nest[/b]' for my english project and I came across an interesting sentence...
"[i][b]All up the coast[/b][/i] I could see the signs of what the [i][b]Combine[/b][/i] had accomplished; [i][b]a train stopping at a station and laying a string of full-grown men in mirrored suits[/b][/i]...like a hatch of [i][b]identical insects[/b][/i], [i][b]half-life[/b][/i] things..."
Sound familiar? The book was published in 1962 but it's still oddly fitting. :3

item.title: OFOTCN - Coincidential Reference
item.dc:creator: Orpheon
item.description:
Interesting. I read that book in high school but I don’t remember that line. Oh well, still cool.

Read full topic

item.description:
I’ve been reading ‘One Flew Over The Cuckoo’s Nest’ for my english project and I came across an interesting sentence…

“All up the coast I could see the signs of what the Combine had accomplished; a train stopping at a station and laying a string of full-grown men in mirrored suits…like a hatch of identical insects, half-life things…”

Sound familiar? The book was published in 1962 but it’s still oddly fitting. :3
